ovdesc.p: This table is used to enable dynamic switching of a Version, Enquiry, Composite Screen, Tabbed Screen or user Menu based on some predefined criteria
The ID format should be a valid ID from one of the following applications:
The ID may also have an optional valid Region or Country code appended, separated with a hyphen character to determine if the switch is specific to that region or country.
As the ID determines whether the switching is for a Version, Enquiry, Tabbed Screen, Composite Screen or user Menu, only the corresponding switch field can be used for that record.
Using the contents of this table, T24 will determine whether to switch a given Version, Enquiry, Composite Screen, Tabbed Screen or user Menu with another.
NOTE - The switching defined in this parameter table is only triggered if there is NOT a routine defined in EB.DYNAMIC.ATTRIBUTES for the respective element.

desc.p: Mandatory field that holds a description of the switch rule.
The name of the VERSION to be used instead of the one requested if the criteria are met. This MUST be a version of the same base application.
The name of the EB.TABBED.SCREEN to be used instead of the one requested if the criteria are met.
The name of the HELPTEXT.MENU to be used instead of the one requested if the criteria are met.
The name of the EB.COMPOSITE.SCREEN to be used instead of the one requested if the criteria are met.
The name of the ENQUIRY to be used instead of the one requested if the criteria are met.
